Package org.lapps.datasource

Provides scripted access to annotated documents.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DataSource
    Represents a ranked list of documents with annotations.
    DataSourceCachingStrategy
    Defines how to cache data source based on Query and ViewOptions.
    DataSourceManager
    Basic facility to manage DataSource.
    DocumentStreamReader
    Streams over a list of Document.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConnectionOptions
    Specify how to establish a connection to remote corpus.
    Document
    Stores an annotated document.
    Query
    Queries over DataSource to select matching documents.
    ViewOptions
    Specifies how to present each Document.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DataSourceException
    Exception for Data Source in general.
    NoSuchDataSourceException
    Exception when found no such data source.

Package org.lapps.datasource Description

Provides scripted access to annotated documents. In general, this API includes interfaces for data source users to query (selecting subset) and stream (presenting different view) of an data source to get desired output.

The DataSource interface represents a ranked list of annotated documents, which can be either initialized from a connection or constructed from a selection query of another corpus. After constructed, the corpus can be streamed by iterator reader or used to fetch ad-hoc specific document.

Specifically, an DataSource can be queried by a Query object and return a new DataSource as selected subset of current corpus. The Query queries over corpus to select matching documents. Possible queries include: 1) IR query for lucene/indri e.g. "(president AND Obama)"; 2) regular expression matching query e.g. "(president .* Obama)" over text field and/or annotation field; 3) composite query built from several queries e.g. "(query1 OR !query2)".

Given a corpus, user can stream its documents with different format and aspect by specifying a ViewOptions. The Class ViewOptions specify how to present each document. Possible options include: 1) shows document id; 2) shows document span; 3) shows document content; 4) shows annotation; 5) shows annotation span.

The DataSourceManager provides a basic facility to connect remote data source with ConnectionOptions. The Class ConnectionOptions stores server information such as URL, username, and password. It can also designate a DataSourceCachingStrategy to provide caching layer between remote data source and its local connection.

A Collaboration Diagram:

Example Code:

ConnectionOptions connOptions = new ConnectionOptions();
connOptions.setCorpusUrl(ldcServerUrl);
connOptions.setCachingStrategy(mysqlCachingStrategy);
 
//Connects to a remote corpus server
DataSource aRemoteCorpus = DataSourceManager.connect(connOptions);
 
//Query remote corpus and return a new corpus object
DataSource hitlistCorpus = aRemoteCorpus.subCorpus(keytermQuery);
 
myViewOptions.setDocumentContentShown();
myViewOptions.setAnnotationShown();
DocumentStreamReader reader = hitlistCorpus.getDocumentStreamReader(myViewOptions);
while(reader.hasNext()){
  Document doc = reader.next();
  //do something
}
